english: It’s below zero.; It’s below freezing.
How hot does it get where you’re from?
transliteration: ilgáwwə ɧarrə ʔaddə ʔē fi baládkum?
arabic: الجوّ حرّ أدّ أيْه في بلدْكُم؟

english: Where I’m from, it doesn’t usually get over 30 degrees in the summer.
transliteration: ɣālíban dáragit ilɧarāra ma-bit3addīš talatīn fi -ȿȿēf fi báladi.
arabic: غالِباً درجِةْ الحرارة مبِتْعدّيش تلاتين في الصّيْف في بلدي.

english: It’s hotter than it was yesterday.
khamsin (hot, dusty southerly wind in the spring)
Does it snow where you’re from?
Where I’m from, it snows a lot in the winter.
transliteration: iddúnya bitmáʈʈar talgə ktīr fi -ššíta fi báladi.
arabic: الدُّنْيا بِتْمطّر تلْج كِتير في الشِّتا في بلدي.

english: There was a flash of lightning.
The thunder woke me up last night.
Do you think it’s going to rain?
It looks like (it’s going to) rain.
Cairo has a very arid climate.
